intro: Lytoneuron acutilobum, commonly known as the sharp-lobed lytoneuron, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and alternate leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils, thriving in cool, temperate climates. Its leaves are elongated with sharply pointed lobes, and its flowers are small, yellowish, and clustered in dense inflorescences. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
